explanations.machine learning: The paper investigates the use of machine learning algorithms to detect financial fraud, specifically money laundering.
explanations.supervised learning: The study uses supervised machine learning algorithms to classify establishments based on risk levels.
explanations.classification: The research involves classifying establishments into different risk levels using machine learning algorithms.
explanations.decision tree: The Decision Tree (DT) algorithm is one of the classifiers used in the study, achieving 90% accuracy at the establishment level and 98% at the annual level.
explanations.Random Forest (RF): The Random Forest classifier is used in the study and provided the best result with 93% accuracy at the establishment level and 98% at the annual level.
explanations.Gradient Boosting (GB): The Gradient Boosting algorithm is used in the study, achieving 74% accuracy at the establishment level and 92% at the annual level.
explanations.Nearest Neighbor (KNN): The K-Nearest Neighbor algorithm is used in the study, achieving 87% accuracy at the establishment level and 97% at the annual level.
